step 1: Create account with Google developers, and then create a new project
step 3: Find and enable YouTube Data API v3
step 4: Create credentials for OAuth client ID
step 5: Configure consent screen and set up an application first
step 6: Click external (you can set permissions later)
step 7: Fill in the required fields, esp the Authorised domains for your http://localhost:3000
step 8: Add scopes for all YouTube v3 related API
step 9: Add users (important step) --> add your own email address that you will be connecting to with Google / YouTube
step 10: Click Create OAuth client ID again and you will be asked to add redirect URIs
step 14: Under Credentials section, OAuth 2.0 Client IDs, click the download and this will download a JSON file with all credentials
step 15: Move that downloadad file in the server directory and rename it to .credentials.json
step 16: Move required variables from json to .env file
